cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island (or about 105 mi E of West Palm Beach, FL)
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift WNW tonight, turn NW Tuesday, then recurve NE Wednesday night and move parallel to the U.S. East Coast before accelerating into the North Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Closest coastal encounter likely near the North Carolina Outer Banks (no U.S. landfall presently forecast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Deerfield Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC; Storm Surge Watch north of Deerfield Beach, FL to south of Lantana, FL and Altamaha Sound, GA to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet, FL to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL and north-western Bahamas; Storm Surge Warning Lantana, FL to Altamaha Sound, GA; Tropical Storm Warning north of Deerfield Beach, FL to Jupiter Inlet, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast northward through Georgia and the Carolinas; later the Mid-Atlantic and New England offshore waters
weather_observation.wind: Small (≤15%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into early Saturday; otherwise breezy with gusts 25–35 kt if the track shifts west
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for Boston given current offshore track
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain Friday night/Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and rough seas affecting port approaches beginning late week
